alert.note: Alert for Barry (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 04 at 10:06AM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall received on Thursday and Friday continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following county, Barry. * WHEN...Until 300 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1005 AM CST, gauge reports indicated flooding is ongoing in the advisory area. - This includes the following low water crossings... Flat Creek at Highway U, Rockhouse Creek at Farm Road 2145, Flat Creek at Highway C and Flat Creek at Highway Y. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cassville, Butterfield, Jenkins, Mcdowell and Wheelerville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
